item.title: Youth Day Timeline: The day that ignited the flames of freedom
item.dc:creator: Sarah Evans
item.description:
June 16, 1976, 40 years ago today: a spark ignited by students on the dusty streets of Soweto set in motion a chain of events that would play a key role in the birth of a new democratic South Africa, 18 years later. That fatal day began with peaceful protests but soon escalated into bloodshed, […]

The post Youth Day Timeline: The day that ignited the flames of freedom appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Happy never after: divorce in SA
item.dc:creator: Le Roux Schoeman
item.description:
Wedding venues might be a b$tch to book, but South Africans are also keeping the divorce court pretty busy. Now new data can help you “divorce-proof” your union a little bit, at least statistically-speaking. Happily never after Divorce in SAInfographic This visualisation was first published by Women 24 on 23 June 2016 Resources StatsSA Venngage

The post Happy never after: divorce in SA appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Timeline: Thuli Madonsela’s Big Five
item.dc:creator: Lailah Ryklief
item.description:
Outgoing Public Protector Thuli Madonsela has investigated some of the most high profile politicians in the country, including President Jacob Zuma. (Click on the arrows for more detail)

The post Timeline: Thuli Madonsela’s Big Five appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Voter registration weekend in numbers: E Cape reaches target
item.dc:creator: Siphe Macanda
item.description:
More than 3 million South Africans visited registration stations across the country this weekend to register to vote for the up-coming local government elections, according to the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC). Of the 3.5 million people registering to vote over the weekend, more than 1.1 million are from KwaZulu-Natal. The province registered the most eligible […]

The post Voter registration weekend in numbers: E Cape reaches target appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.
